title: Priority Analysis Process for Improving e-Learning Elements: Application to Mathematics Education

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Learners demonstrate high expertise in mathematics but face challenges using e-learning platforms. In a blended environment, offline lectures and online activities are conducted concurrently, with digital devices (tablets/laptops) provided

learning_goals: Analyze the difficulty and usefulness of e-learning elements (learning design, lecture materials, etc.)
Apply the Quadrant of Difficulty-Usefulness (QoDU) model to prioritize improvements
Develop an action plan to enhance e-learning system performance based on survey data
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
